From heating to mobility – we are taking on the challenges of tomorrow with climate-neutral technology. 🍃🦾2021 was a successful business year for Bosch, with sales rising to 78.7 billion euros. Going forward, we will continue to pursue our objective to help shape climate action by making it our business. Therefore, we will be investing some 3 billion euros over 3 years in climate-neutral technology such as electrification and hydrogen. We’re now even starting to develop components to support the rapid expansion of green hydrogen production. 🏡🏢 Did you know that more than one-third of carbon emissions come from buildings? To aid the transition to alternative heating, we're offering a range of solutions. This includes, for example, heat pumps powered by green electricity, which are paying off especially in new buildings. And we want to do our part in existing buildings as well: With our hydrogen-ready gas-fired boilers, we are facilitating the switch from natural gas heating systems to hydrogen ones.🚘🚛 We are driving the transition to alternative mobility with electromobility on two key technological paths: battery-electric and based on fuel cells. With intelligent thermal management, for example, the electric driving range can be increase by 25%. For electric mobility based on fuel cells, we will be starting the production of fuel-cell powertrains for trucks this year. #BoschAPC #futuretech #electrification #hydrogen #climateneutrality #sustainability #heating #electromobility

Decoding tomorrow: What do you think are the key technologies for the future?Microelectronics, for example, is one of the technologies that will continue to play a key role. Without it, we wouldn’t have computers or modern cars. 💻🚘In our video, Bosch chairman Stefan Hartung outlines examples of technologies that will enable leaps forward – for instance in mobility, medical diagnostics, and the energy transition. 🚛🏥⚡ He also mentions an even more crucial aspect, besides technology, for taking on the challenges of the future. 💡🤝#BoschAPC #microelectronics #fuelcells #quantumsensors #AI #artificialintelligence #futuretech

🌍🍃 Decoding tomorrow: Climate change is one of the biggest challenges humanity is facing. What do you think companies should do to take action for the climate? 🤔From making our locations carbon-neutral to cutting the carbon footprint of our products: For us at Bosch, climate action isn’t something we aim to do alongside or on top of our business – we are making it our business. Check out the video to watch our chairman Stefan Hartung give an example of where we see the potential to do even more. Stay tuned for more updates on how we want to contribute to tackling current and future challenges at our annual press conference on May 4. #BoschAPC#climateaction #circulareconomy #carbonfootprint #futuretech

Have you ever tried your luck at a funfair claw machine? Did the gripping claw appear to be hard to maneuver and imprecise, making it tough to win? Find out what it takes to design a claw machine that always works in the latest episode of our "From KNOW-HOW to WOW" podcast.Our hosts speak with Christoph Marx, a Bosch robot engineer, who developed the Smart Item Picking robot system for warehouses. His goal was to create a system that combined hardware, visual sensors, and software algorithms to manage millions of distinct pieces with varying forms, sizes, weights, and other unknown factors. Christoph discusses how he and his colleagues came up with the solution using artificial intelligence and a 3D scanner. 💻🦾You can find this episode and more on podcast platforms such as Podigee, Apple Podcasts, Deezer, and Spotify. Simply search for "From KNOW-HOW to WOW" and get ready to be wowed. 🎧😎#podcast #technology #robot #robotics #manufacturing #AI #artificialintelligence #sensors

Have you ever tried to hang a picture and realised it’s not straight? With our new Quigo Green, this will be a thing of the past. 🖼️📏This self-leveling laser projects horizontal and vertical laser lines onto a wall, allowing you to easily hang pictures, tile walls, and fix curtain rails without the need for a second pair of hands to hold a spirit level. The green laser lines are up to four times more visible than the traditional red lines, and as Quigo Green allows you to measure up to 12 meters away, you can complete a huge range of DIY tasks at home. 🏠We have also worked to make the new Quigo Green a more environmentally friendly tool. Thanks to significantly enhanced electronics, it requires 50% less energy than the previous model. This generates less waste, and means you need to use fewer batteries. 🔋🍃  #DIY #homeimprovement #decoration #powertools #sustainability #sustainableproducts

How do you make a product more sustainable? 🤔That’s the big question for Isabelle Gola, head of sustainability strategy, and Simon Kalt, sustainability coordinator and expert in measuring tools at Bosch Power Tools."Waste and greenhouse gases have an enormous impact on the environment," explains Isabelle. "Our aim is to make products with the smallest possible carbon footprint." 🌎🍃The team is working to achieve a long-term reduction in carbon footprint and encourage circular business models. To accomplish this, they are following several steps in the design and development of new power tools. This includes conducting a life cycle analysis to identify carbon hot spots early, using recycled plastics and greener packaging, as well as making products eco-friendlier with enhanced electronics for longer battery life. ♻️#recycling #carbonemissions #ecodesign #DIY #powertools #packaging #carbonneutral #sustainability

🌎🍃Laser-focused on going green: From the product itself to the packaging, the new Quigo Green is our first ever power tool to have a significantly reduced carbon footprint. With its casing made with 85% recycled plastic, the self-leveling laser can project green laser lines onto a wall, helping you to hang your pictures straight and to easily complete other DIY tasks.  Additionally, we use at least 70% recycled paper for the packaging material. The Quigo Green box is also coated with an environmentally-friendly, water-based lacquer, and no longer contains any plastic film. This will allow us to eliminate the use of around 172,000 plastic bags during production of the product in 2022. ♻️🧰 #recycling #carbonfootprint #ecodesign #DIY #powertools #packaging #carbonneutral #sustainability

🎵 Meet Sofie Birch, a sound artist and producer based in Copenhagen, Denmark – a city that has invested heavily in cycling infrastructure, with the aim of becoming mostly car-free in the next decade. 🍃🚲Sofie shares the city's passion for a greener lifestyle. To record sounds to use in her artistic productions, she moves around the city and surrounding areas, often traveling for over 10 km a day. To get around easily and sustainably while carrying her equipment, Sofie uses a Bosch ePowered cargo bike as her mode of transportation. Thanks to the electric support of our powerful Cargo Line drive, it can carry heavy loads of up to 250 kg and helps her contribute to making the city greener. 🏙️🍃#cargobike #cargobikes #ebike #boschebike #eCargo #sustainability #sustainable

🌲🔥 Zoomed in: How can precious forests be protected from wildfire? With the help of an intelligent sensor! With up to 20% of annual CO2 emissions worldwide caused by wildfires, discovering and stopping them early is an important part when it comes to protecting our planet – and that's where our sensor can help. Inside the Silvanet system, developed by the start-up Dryad, our sensor quietly monitors air composition, temperature, humidity, and air pressure. Just 3 by 3 mm in size, it is the world's first gas sensor with artificial intelligence and allows for fires to be detected ultra-early during the smoldering phase already. If a fire is detected, the system alerts emergency services instantly, who can prevent it from spreading. 👩‍🚒👨‍🚒 #EarthDay #artificialintelligence #AI #InternetofThings #IoT #sensortechnology #sensor

"What benefits do you hope technology and technological progress will bring?" 🤔 This was one of the questions, we've asked participants as part of our Tech Compass survey. One of the most frequent responses: safety. At Bosch, we are developing technology that can make the future of mobility safer. One example: our steer-by-wire system. Here, a virtual link replaces the mechanical connection between the steering wheel actuator and the road wheels. This provides increased responsiveness when maneuvering, enhances safety by shortening braking distances under mixed road surface conditions, and can help avoid under and oversteering through precision handling. 🚘 #technology #futuretrends #TechCompass #mobility #safety #roadsafety

"Make life more comfortable" – this was one of the top responses for the question in our Tech Compass survey when we asked people from 5 different countries around the world what benefits they hope technology will bring. 🚘🅿️ One example of how technology can make life more comfortable is "automated valet parking", a system which we developed together with Mercedes-Benz Group AG. Here, our intelligent infrastructure monitors the car park's driving corridor and its surroundings with sensors. This gives the vehicle the information to driverlessly drive up and down ramps and change levels within the car park to get to its parking space. If the sensors detect an obstacle, the vehicle brakes immediately to a safe standstill. This technology not only eliminates the need for you to search for a parking space, but handles the task of parking the vehicle, too. And for that extra level of comfort, other convenience services such as a car wash or electric-vehicle charging are also possible. ⚡🔋#automateddriving #automatedparking #mobility #TechCompass #futuretechnology

Are you familiar with the tradition of Easter egg hunting? 🥚🐰🐣💐Our Bosch Research robotics department certainly is... 😉 Make sure to keep watching until the end! 🕺🦾 @bostondynamicsofficial #easteregg #easteregghunt #researchanddevelopment #roboticstechnology

Working toward our aim of getting safe automated driving onto the roads: By acquiring Five, Europe’s leading start-up in the field of automated driving, we are giving our work in software development for self-driving vehicles an extra boost. 🌐💻 The start-up focuses primarily on a cloud-based development and testing platform for the software used in self-driving cars. This offers engineers the programs they need to create automated driving software swiftly, and to test it before and during its deployment in test vehicles.#selfdrivingvehicles #automateddriving #roadsafety #futuremobility 📷 by Five

🚘🏍️ The main season for summer testing is about to start at our test tracks in Boxberg, Germany. ☀️Around the globe, Bosch operates 10 different proving grounds. The locations range from Vaitoudden in northern Sweden to Tolhuin in southern Argentina. Before a new or improved vehicle system can enter the market, an important step is testing – in scenarios that match everyday driving as well as under special conditions. Our Boxberg proving ground is equipped with a variety of different test tracks, including a high-speed oval and floodable braking tracks. A broad mix of driving and weather conditions can be simulated to provide testing options for vehicle dynamics, connected mobility, automated systems or powertrain solutions. #futuremobility #provingground #testtrack #vehicletesting #roadsafety

Being a diversified company offers the chance to transfer knowledge from one area to another. 🔄🌐 Back in the middle of the 20th century, we used our existing capabilities in radar and radio technology as the starting point for our expansion into the health care market. Our years of experience with radio tubes, for instance, enabled the launch of the "Omniton" hearing aid where tubes in miniaturized form were used to help amplify the signals. 🦻Today, we still draw upon our core competencies, for example in the area of connectivity, when developing solutions for supporting people's health. One example: our "Vivatmo me" FeNO measuring device. As the first FeNO measuring device for home use, it allows asthma patients to determine the current degree of inflammation in their airways. The measured values are displayed as a monthly overview in the accompanying diary app and can also be shared with the patient’s doctor. 👨‍⚕️👩‍⚕️#WorldHealthDay #healthiertomorrow #health #healthcare #healthcaresolutions #asthma

April 7 marks #WorldHealthDay. 🌍 To our company founder Robert Bosch, the promotion of health care was always an important matter. He made sure his charitable efforts would be continued by establishing the foundation "Robert Bosch Stiftung".To tackle future challenges within the health care sector, the "Robert Bosch Stiftung" recently united its institutions and funding activities in the area of health care in the newly founded Bosch Health Campus. Located on the grounds of the Robert Bosch Hospital in Stuttgart, Germany, the campus focuses on patient care, research, education, and training. It is designed to be a place with a rapid and direct transfer of research into treatment – for example within the field of cancer research, where the aim is to develop solutions to treat the disease in an even more targeted manner. #healthiertomorrow #health #healthcare #research 📷 by Marek Vogel

How can the safety and comfort of motorcycle riding be improved? Bosch software engineer Yuki Oshida knows the answer: By using advanced rider assistance systems (ARAS). 🏍️In the latest episode of our "From KNOW-HOW to WOW" podcast, he and Daniel Vetter, an application engineer for motorcycle safety systems at Bosch, talk about these radar-based assistance systems and explain how some of the functions were transferred from passenger cars to motorcycles. One example: Adaptive cruise control, which adapts the motorcycle's speed to ensure that there is a sufficient gap to the vehicle in front.Additionally, podcast host and motorcycle enthusiast Shuko was able to test the technology in real life on an exclusive ARAS test ride with Daniel. She is convinced: Electronic assistants can help to mitigate some of the inherent risks of motorcycling without compromising fun. Listen to this episode and more on podcast platforms like Podigee, Apple Podcasts, Deezer, and Spotify. Simply search for "From KNOW-HOW to WOW" and get ready to be wowed. 🎧😎#podcast #motorcycle #safety #roadsafety #mobility #technology

Every year, people all over the world join together for #EarthHour, an event established to increase awareness of protecting nature and tackling the climate crisis by switching off the lights for one hour. 🌍🍃Our smart home technology makes participating in Earth Hour simple by using your smart devices with intelligent automations. More importantly, it can also assist in long-term energy saving. You can, for example, activate a "leaving home" or "goodnight" scenario: This way, not only are all the connected smart lights and devices switched off, but also all linked smart plugs – ensuring that no standby power is consumed.#EarthHour2022 #Connect2Earth #sustainability #saveenergy #smarthome #automation #IoT #InternetofThings #smartliving

Bosch associate Scott Kasin has been a passionate cyclist since childhood. Now, working at Bosch eBike Systems, he combines his enthusiasm for cycling with another aspect that is important to him: improving rider safety through digitalization. 🚴An example of this is our smart system for eBikes, which is evolving to use vehicle-to-everything (V2X) communication. With this, both drivers and riders could be alerted of each other’s proximity while on the road, thereby helping to reduce the number of accidents between vehicles and vulnerable road users. 🚵‍♂‍#ebike #emobility #technology #connectivity #cycling #bikes #electricbike #ebikestagram

Today’s International Day of Forests aims to raise awareness about the importance of all types of forests for people and the planet. 🌲🌳As forest fires around the world continue to have a significant negative impact, the environmental start-up Dryad has developed an ultra-early wildfire detection solution. The "digital nose" of the Silvanet system is a network of our highly sensitive sensors equipped with artificial intelligence. By monitoring the air composition, temperature, humidity, and air pressure they detect forest fires early on – even during the smoldering phase. Then, in the case of a developing fire, the system wirelessly issues an alert.Stay tuned for more, we have some updates on this topic coming soon!#IntlForestDay #climatechange #artificialintelligence #AI #AIoT #IoT #sensortechnology #sensor

In these hard times, a huge number of people worldwide are willing to help those affected by the war in Ukraine. Bosch associates from countries all over the world, especially in those neighboring Ukraine, are helping to provide relief – by offering shelter, by donating, or by helping at the frontier. The picture shows associates from our plant in Blaj, Romania, preparing packages with donated products for refugees. To help coordinate the associates’ efforts, the Bosch crisis team has set up a central internal community that brings together those associates looking for help with those offering their support.For us as a company, helping and supporting people affected by the war remains the top priority. We are working to keep our local associates and their families safe and to offer them help wherever possible. We are also supporting humanitarian aid in the region with our donation to the German Red Cross.#StandWithUkraine

War can never be the answer to political conflict. Our thoughts and sympathy are with all those who are feeling the effects of the war in Ukraine and are suffering personal hardship. We are devoting all our energies to the welfare of our local associates and their families. In addition, Bosch facilities in neighboring countries will be made available as refugee accommodation. We are also supporting humanitarian aid in the region by making a donation to the German Red Cross and are examining further ways of helping locally.

How can digitalization improve manufacturing? In the latest episode of our "From KNOW-HOW to WOW" podcast, our hosts speak with Marian Demme, senior solutions architect for Industrial Internet of Things at Bosch, about the smart factory of the future. 🌐🏭Factory digitalization can make them more efficient and resource-friendly by connecting their manufacturing and logistical processes. NEXEED, our Industry 4.0 software portfolio, functions as the brain of a production facility: It reads data from linked machinery and delivers relevant information in real time. Marian and his colleague Tobias Pfister implemented it on the production lines at the Bosch plant in Bamberg, Germany. Now, a single motor valve can have a record of over 1,000 data points attached to it, resulting in fewer errors and increased efficiency.You can find this episode and more on podcast platforms such as Podigee, Apple Podcasts, Deezer, and Spotify. Simply search for "From KNOW-HOW to WOW" and get ready to be wowed. 🎧😎#podcast #technology #IoT #manufacturing #efficiency #digitalization

Have a guess: What does the round object in the picture have to do with increasing the range of an electric vehicle? 🤔In a complex manufacturing process, we are turning these circular discs, called wafers, into innovative silicon-carbide power semiconductors. In the form of microchips and used in the power electronics of electric vehicles, they ensure that drivers can drive significantly further on one battery charge. This is possible as they lose only half as much energy in the form of heat compared to pure silicon chips. 🚘📱 From cars to smartphones: The global demand for microchips in general is continuously growing in the automotive and consumer sectors. That’s why we’re further extending our wafer fab in Reutlingen, Germany, by investing more than 250 million euros. This comes on top of the 400-million-euro investment already announced for the expansion of our global semiconductor production in 2022. #evehicles #emobility #electriccar #technology #semiconductors

Did you know that prior to the Bosch magneto ignition, there were two options for the process used to ignite the fuel in engines of motor vehicles? One of them was a battery-powered system characterized by a limited range, the other one was a glow-tube system which required an extremely dangerous open flame. 🔥To make the automobile an everyday mode of transportation, the reliability of the ignition process had to be improved. And that’s what we did: In 1897, we achieved a breakthrough by making a fundamental design modification to an existing magneto ignition system used for stationary engines. This altered the way the electrical energy was generated, enabling the large number of ignition processes needed for smaller and faster vehicle motors. Thanks to the success of this then high-tech solution, production volumes at the company increased exponentially. This allowed our company founder Robert Bosch for example to expand from his modest workshop in Germany into promising new markets such as the UK in 1898, and paved the way of Bosch becoming a global company. 🌍 #hightech #automotive #automotivetechnology #history #historylovers #historyinpictures #historyfacts

SoundSee – our intelligent troubleshooter. 🚀 Since late 2019, the sensor system analyzes sounds and uses artificial intelligence to monitor the condition of machinery aboard the International Space Station. Whether for electrically adjusting the seat, recharging the vehicle, or deploying the airbag – software is already an integral part of almost every function in modern vehicles. 🌐🚘Today, a vehicle is delivered as a finished product. This, however, is set to change in the future with software-defined vehicles. What is a software-defined vehicle? 🤔 It’s smart, connected, and update-ready. This means, that the car’s software can be continuously improved and expanded, creating a customized digital driving experience with new features to be enabled on an individual basis depending on the driver’s needs.At Bosch, we want to set the course for that and shape the software-defined future of mobility. That’s why we’re investing around three billion euros every year in our mobility software expertise. Additionally, we’re also pooling our development activities for application-independent software under the umbrella of our subsidiary ETAS GmbH as of mid-2022.#evehicles #emobility #technology #mobility #IoT #connected #personalized #CES2022 #BoschCES

Klara's asthma had always made her and her family feel anxious and helpless. The fact that she found taking regular peak flow measurements to monitor her asthma reliably rather complicated and that they often failed to produce clear values, did not ease those feelings. Thanks to our “Vivatmo me” FeNO home measuring device, those days are over. 🙌The “Vivatmo me” measures the FeNO value, which indicates the degree of inflammation in the lungs. The results are uploaded automatically to the accompanying smartphone app. Klara performs the measurements on her own and measures her FeNO value about once a week. Through this easy way of monitoring the inflammation in her lungs, she can judge what to expect in certain situations and what activities she can participate in. ⛹️‍♀️🚴‍♀️🤸‍♀️#healthcare #healthcaresolutions #technology #globalasthmanetwork #asthma #respiratorydisease #lungdisease #defeatasthma

From alarm systems to lighting, heating, and home appliances: Our @homeconnectplus app allows you to control, automate, and monitor your smart home devices centrally in a single app – even when they are from different brands. 🏡📱👍Need more personalization? Combine your devices and design intelligent automations. Start your day, for example, with a "breakfast" automation to brew your coffee and play some music. Or try a "home office" automation to have the heating system bring your office to the perfect temperature and turn on your lamp ready for work. ☕📻💡But a smart home not only makes your life more comfortable, it can also help you live more sustainably. Save energy by adjusting your heating system to your needs at certain times. By combining your smart heating thermostat with smart window sensors, you can also prevent unnecessary energy loss, as the smart heating system automatically turns down the connected thermostats when windows are open. 📱🌡️#homeconnectplus #smarthome #automation #smarthouse #internetofthings #IoT

Renewable sources of energy tend to be volatile. Changes in sunlight intensity for example lead to fluctuations in the amount of power generated through solar panels. 🌤️🍃When generating power utilizing a solar energy system in a household, making sure to use the energy available efficiently seems achievable: Appliances like a washing machine, which don’t require any energy unless they’re running, are turned on specifically at times when the energy generation is high, for example on a sunny day. But how can this be done at a much larger scale – at a factory with set production schedules, for example? That’s what our experts are working on!🏭 At our location in Eisenach, Germany, energy consumption is being monitored and optimized using our Balancing Energy Network. The software solution uses artificial intelligence and machine learning to assess consumption and to predict whether there is scope to defer production processes – and the power consumption this involves – to a more favorable time. That’s how we can improve energy efficiency at the production site and the quality of our carbon neutrality. #sustainability #sustainable #solarenergy #renewableenergy #energyefficiency #manufacturing #boscheisenach

What do you do for power when your construction site is in the middle of a river? 🤔 That's exactly the challenge the track designers of the @RedBullGermany Wake Capital wakeboarding competition faced. 🏄 They had two weeks to build a stomach-churning 240-meter-long track on the Elbe river in Hamburg, Germany. But this was not your average build: It was a floating site, with no access to electrical sockets, and tide differentials of over four meters. 🌊Using 20 tons of materials and 2,000 screws, the team constructed nine obstacles for 16 of the world's top wakeboarders to take on. And our @boschprofessionaleurope 18V cordless tools helped them to get the job done. "The batteries work with everything," says track designer David Vervenne. "Switching tools is easy because the same battery just works anywhere. It makes work twice as fast."#boschprofessional #boschtools #powertools #wakecapital #construction #wakeboarding

Whether you take daily routes through the city or test yourself with sporting adventures in the mountains, our eBike smart system, which consists of the eBike Flow app, control unit, digital display, battery, and drive unit, delivers an individual eBike experience that includes automatic activity tracking, individual adjustment of support levels, and more.Having recently been awarded the "CES® 2022 Innovation Awards Honoree" in the category "Vehicle Intelligence & Transportation", we’ll be showcasing the smart system and more at next year’s Consumer Electronics Show (@CES) in Las Vegas, US. 🎉🙌Make sure to follow us and join us when we’re once again at one of the world’s best-known electronics trade fairs from January 4 to 8, 2022. #eBike #connectedbiking #ebiking #boschebike #IoT #CES2022 #BoschCES #cycling #streetflow #uphillflow

Goodbye hassle, hello convenience! ⚡🔋📱 Did you know that the average electric vehicle driver has as many as six recharging apps on their smartphone? 😭 With our "Charge My EV" app, the days of juggling multiple apps are over!   As part of our "convenience charging" system, the app gives users access to one of Europe's largest charging networks, consisting of over 260,000 public charging stations. At the station, charging time and cost can be conveniently displayed by simply scanning the charging point’s QR code. 📱 After scanning the QR code, the charging can be started without typing in a password or registering. And once it is completed, the charging point switches off and the driver receives a notification to their device. The payment is then done automatically in the app using the stored payment method. 🙌#evehicles #emobility #technology #mobility #electromobility #electricvehicle #electricvehiclecharging #electricdrive

If you’re driving an electric vehicle, you might have experienced it: During a long ascent while driving in mountainous terrain, the displayed battery range plummets suddenly but returns to a normal level when the car heads downhill again or the road levels out. ⚡🔋 🚘When conventional on-board computers inaccurately display an electric vehicle’s range based on current energy consumption, it can create anxious moments for drivers. With our “convenience charging” system, this will be a thing of the past. The system is equipped with highly accurate range forecasting, which not only takes the current power consumption into account but also incorporates real-time vehicle data such as battery temperature, weight, air drag, and road resistance. Traffic, weather, topographical, and other data are also factored into the equation, giving an accurate forecast, and allowing you to relax, enjoy the scenery, and make the most of your trip. ⛰️🛣️#IoT #evehicles #emobility #electriccar #Technology

⚡🔋 Find charging stations, charge, and pay easily and conveniently: Meet Bosch associate and electric vehicle driver Sonja Bloechlinger, who used our “convenience charging” system with vehicle integration and accompanying smartphone app on her road trip from Stuttgart, Germany, to Zurich, Switzerland.To plan her trip, Sonja simply entered her destination in our “Charge My EV” smartphone app and chose from a number of charging points displayed along the way. Thanks to the vehicle integration of our system, the app then sent the route to her vehicle’s infotainment system once she got into the car. 📱For a more personalized charging experience, Sonja also set the app to display points of interest near charging stations, so she can explore the beauty of nature or relax at a café in town while her vehicle is charging. 🏙️⛰️ #IoT #evehicles #emobility #electriccar #roadtrip

⛰️ Did you know that as an enthusiastic and very sporting nature lover, our company founder Robert Bosch enjoyed spending his time off with his family in the mountains? This love of nature also applied to his professional life where he implemented sustainable practices in the workplace from as early as 1920. A 1920 workplace regulation of his that aimed to avoid wastefulness, featured the guideline: “Waste is to be separated by type and placed in the specially designated containers provided.” ♻️ Over one hundred years later, his passion for sustainability is still present across the company, with more than 400 Bosch locations worldwide being climate neutral since 2020. We are further committed to expanding our climate action by also focusing on our indirect emissions, such as purchased goods and services, logistics and use of our products. Here, we have an ambitious target and aim to reduce our indirect emissions by 15% by 2030.🌍🍃  #sustainability #sustainable #carbonneutral #environment #climateaction

Office with a view. And a vision. 🍃 At Bosch, we want to do our part when it comes to protecting the environment. This also includes making sure that our products are increasingly environmentally friendly and sustainable. To achieve this, we are working #LikeABosch on a number of different projects: From developing strategies to make our power tools and their packaging more sustainable, to working on producing sophisticated industry technology from recycled material, to creating products that truly show our commitment to the circular economy, and more. #sustainability #sustainable #sustainableproducts #productdevelopment #research #researchanddevelopment

The cornerstone of modern technology: Semiconductors in the form of microchips can be found in smartphones, TVs, dishwashers, and many other technical devices as well as in cars. Did you know that without semiconductors, cars wouldn't work, neither today nor in the future? ❌🚘As the worldwide demand for chips is continuing to grow rapidly, we're systematically expanding our semiconductor production. In 2022 alone, we will be investing over 400 million euros in our wafer fabs in Dresden and Reutlingen, Germany, and the semiconductor operations in Penang, Malaysia.#semiconductors #microchips #technology #mobility #manufacturing #wafer

Could you imagine today’s world without the internet? 🌐 Given the significant impact it has on society and culture, and also its enormous influence on technology and communications for businesses, it seems impossible for many to picture life today without the internet. 🌍💻 #InternetDayAs the leading conference on AIoT and digital transformation, our Bosch ConnectedWorld features all kinds of innovations in artificial intelligence, the Internet of Things, and digital transformation in the areas of mobility, manufacturing, sustainability, and more. Join us and find out what the future holds when it comes to connected products and services! Taking place as a new hybrid event on 16-17 February 2022, you can now secure your free or premium ticket on bosch-connected-world.com and join either in Berlin, Germany, or online from anywhere in the world.#IoT #AI #digitaltransformation #BCW22

🎧 Who am I? An existential question that is hard to answer in a connected world. Proving your identity online is complicated when ID cards are still physical. 🤔In the latest episode of our podcast "From KNOW-HOW to WOW", Bosch researcher Christian Bormann talks about a technology that could help regain control over online identities using a special form of digital wallet: self-sovereign identities. They use cutting-edge cryptography to ensure the securest communication. Meanwhile, our host Geoff meets mentalist Thorsten Havener. Will he reveal Geoff’s true identity?Want to find out more? Then listen to the latest episode of our podcast on podcast platforms such as Podigee, Apple Podcasts, Deezer, and Spotify! Simply search for "From KNOW-HOW to WOW" and get ready to be wowed. 😎#podcast #technology #cryptography #digitalsecurity #privacy #dataprivacy

🚴‍♂️ Do you enjoy exploring new eBike routes on your vacation? To make planning your adventures even easier, we’ve collaborated with @komoot, the leading route planning app. Together with regional tour experts, we’ve developed new tour suggestions specifically for eBikes in popular holiday regions in Germany, Austria, and Switzerland.Using our eBike systems displays and the komoot app, you can now easily pick from a selection of well-known popular routes or select paths that are less frequently traveled and start your route right from the front door of your hotel.And whether you're an ambitious eMountainbiker searching for your next exciting trail or looking for a less demanding family-friendly path to enjoy, in our komoot collections you can find a tour to suit your fitness and desired difficulty. Check out @BoscheBikeSystems for more! #ebike #emobility #technology #connectivity #cycling  #bikes #electricbike #ebikestagram #komoot #komootadventurer

🎨 October 25 is #InternationalArtistDay: Meet Roberto Rivadeneira, a contemporary visual artist living in Berlin, Germany, who created a mural inspired by his experiences during the pandemic. His work on a ten-meter industrial wall forms part of a project titled “No art, no noise – saving culture in the time of corona.” Scaling a sketch up to seven by four meters using conventional methods would usually take him a long time. Thanks to our @boschprofessionaleurope laser measuring device and MeasureOn app, Roberto was able to finish this piece in just one day. After he measured the dimensions of the wall, the data was uploaded automatically to his smartphone and tablet. This allowed him to calculate the dimensions in the correct proportion quickly and easily, and drastically reduce errors and the steps involved. Check out the video to see Roberto at work! #creative #technology #lasertechnology #powertools #art #artist #visualartist

Preparing for the electrifying times ahead: Are you already using an electric car? Or are you thinking about driving one in the near future? 🚘⚡ The demand for electromobility worldwide is rising: It is expected that in 2035, 60% of all newly registered cars worldwide will be electric. By offering a broad range of solutions, we're helping to pave the way for all kinds of electromobility applications. What does this mean for you when driving an electric car? It means, for example, easy re-charging thanks to our flexible smart charging cable, and increased vehicle range thanks to silicon carbide semiconductor technology in our generation 4 inverter. To learn more about these and our other solutions, head over to bosch-mobility-solutions.com. #electromobility #mobility #electricvehicle #electriccar #technology

💧🌧️ Save drinking water #LikeABosch: Looking for a way to help the plants and lawn in your garden grow while conserving natural resources? Make use of collected rainwater easily and quickly with our cordless GardenPump 18. It works with a wide range of garden rainwater tanks, and with its timer function for sprinklers and irrigation systems, it helps you to use only the amount of rainwater you really need. #sustainability #sustainable #gardening #sustainablegarden #sustainablegardening #powertools @boschdiyandgarden

🏎️🏁 What does it take to develop an autonomous race car prototype?That’s exactly the question 50 engineering students from the University of Modena and Reggio Emilia in Italy had to ask themselves when designing, developing, and constructing their race car for the Formula SAE, a competition in which students from universities around the world challenge each other by competing with their vehicles on the racetrack.@boschitalia_official supported the team based in the heart of the Italian Motor Valley on their journey, providing products and technical training on the way to creating their single-seater self-driving prototype for the new class of the Formula SAE competition dedicated to autonomous vehicles.#autonomousvehicles #selfdrivingvehicle #automateddriving #FormulaSAE #motorracing

Sustainability is a key aspect when developing our products, and the @boschdiyandgarden Quigo Green is a good example of how we consistently implement our sustainability strategy. 🍃 The line laser consumes 50% less energy than its predecessor, and the accessories are made of sustainable materials, too, with recycled plastic making up 85% of the product housing and 95% of the adapter plate. Even the packaging has been made more environmentally friendly, the recycled cardboard uses a water-based coating, and the box no longer contains any plastic foils inside. ♻️ That's why the @SolarImpulse Foundation awarded the Quigo Green an "Efficient Solution" label for raw material efficiency, sustainable packaging, and supply chain efficiency. #sustainability #packaging #sustainable #recyclability #recycling #ecofriendly #carbonneutral #carbonneutrality

Did you know that wildfires are responsible for around 20% of annual global CO2 emissions? The Silvanet system, developed by environmental start-up Dryad, aims to save 400 million tons of CO2 emissions as an ultra-early wildfire detection IoT solution. 🍃The system uses a network of our Bosch Sensortec highly sensitive gas sensors to monitor the air composition, temperature, humidity, and air pressure. The sensors use artificial intelligence built into the device to reliably detect wildfires in under 60 minutes, even during the smoldering phase, enabling the system to immediately issue an alert to relevant parties in the case of a fire. 🚒After the first live demonstration, Dryad is now working on ten proof of concept deployments in the US, Europe, Australia, Indonesia, and Africa. 🌍#sustainability #sensors #IoT #AI #artificialintelligence #environment

Does interacting with your pet help your mental wellbeing during challenging times? 🦜🐱🐶🐐🐴October 10 is #WorldMentalHealthDay, a @who initiative to raise awareness of mental health issues around the world. Check out the video and meet their furry and feathered friends!#worldmentalhealthday2021 #mentalhealthawareness #mentalhealth #emotionalhealth #mentahealthmatters

Celebrate #WorldVegetarianDay with our red melon carpaccio! 🍉😋 Last week, Bosch associates around the world had a chance to try this special dish in our canteens to mark the 160th birthday of our company founder Robert Bosch. Now, Sebastian Luttenberger, chef in the canteen at our headquarters in Germany, shows how to prepare our signature dish, so you can make it yourself. Watch the video and get cooking! 👩‍🍳👨‍🍳Here are the ingredients you need (serves four): ▪️ 1 kg organic mini watermelon▪️ 1/2 bunch of arugula▪️ 1 lemon▪️ 6 tbsp olive oil▪️ 2 tbsp olives▪️ 2 tbsp pine nuts▪️ 8 sage leaves▪️ 200 g focaccia (or other white bread)▪️ 80 g Pecorino cheese▪️ Salt and pepper#cooking #cookingathome #recipe #vegetarianrecipes #food #foodie

🎧 Put on your headphones, it’s time for a new episode of our "From KNOW-HOW to WOW" podcast!This time, we are talking about change – which is often exciting, but rarely frictionless. Our e-mobility experts Bruno Schuster and Jan Alsmeier, who works in process management, explain why they swapped silicon for silicon carbide in semiconductor production. Spoiler alert: This was a pretty challenging change. In any case, it could be a true leap forward in e-mobility technology because tiny amounts of silicon carbide in an electric car can have a big impact on the vehicle’s weight and energy efficiency. And speaking of change: This is also the first episode of our new co-host Shuko. Will there be any friction between her and Geoff? 😉 We’ll find out!Want to find out more? Then listen to the latest episode of our podcast on podcast platforms such as Podigee, Apple Podcasts, Deezer, and Spotify! Simply search for "From KNOW-HOW to WOW" and get ready to be wowed. 😎#podcast #emobility #semiconductors #mobility #automateddriving

⚡️ Did you know that a single solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) system can generate up to 10 kW of power? That's enough to provide more than 20 four-person households with electricity.By connecting individual SOFC units, our systems can also be organized in larger plants and be used to power commercial buildings, industrial parks, data centers, clinics, universities, e-vehicle charging stations, and modern urban neighborhoods.We're currently working with other organizations to create real-life use cases for the SOFC system. One of those organizations is Stadtwerke Bamberg, a municipal utility in Germany. The result: The former ticket office of Bamberg’s central bus station now has one of our SOFC systems installed, which has not only been feeding electricity into the public grid, but also generates warmth that the bakery inside the bus station uses for its heating and hot-water systems.#sustainableenergy #technology #sustainable #sustainability #energy #electricity #fuelcell

🍃⚡ Welcome to the future of energy generation: The global demand for electricity is rising. To satisfy it in line with climate action goals, sustainable and eco-friendly ways to generate energy are needed. We've got a solution: The stationary solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC), in which an electrochemical reaction generates electricity and heat. Developed as a prototype by Ceres Power, we've turned it into a universally deployable, high-performance system that can be mass-produced. To enable the commercialization of the SOFC system, Bosch engineer Havva Ana Göcmen and her team are working on creating the optimum conditions for mass-manufacturing solid oxide fuel cells at our Bamberg plant in Germany. This includes, for example, how they can speed up cycle times as well as the automation of production and testing processes.#climatechange #sustainableenergy #technology #sustainable #sustainability #energy #electricity #solidoxidefuelcell

Happy birthday, Robert Bosch! 🎂 Today marks the 160th birthday of the visionary, philanthropist, and founder of our company.In November 1886, 25-year-old Robert Bosch opened his first workshop in a courtyard in Stuttgart, Germany. From the start, he had a very precise idea of the principles and values he wished his company to uphold. While quality was one of his top priorities, he was also convinced that technology should be designed to improve people's lives. To this day, we, as a company, maintain our founder’s principles and values and use them as drivers of innovation when developing our products and solutions.Discover more about our company's history in the history blog on our bosch.com website. #throwback #tbt #history #companyhistory #values #founder #tradition

Zoomed in: Testing, testing, testing! 🚘🛣️ This is crucial when it comes to developing safe and reliable technology.On the tracks of our proving grounds in Boxberg, Germany, we usually put technology to the test. In this case though, a training session took place for Bosch associates who will be operating test cars for highly automated driving on public roads.Pursuing our goal of accident-free road traffic, we are constantly working on making automated driving a reality. An exciting #IAA21 week has come to an end! 🙌 What were your personal #BoschIAA highlights?➡️ For more info on the products and solutions we showcased, check out:@boschmotorsport @boschebikesystems @bosch_einfach_heizen @boschsmarthomede @boschhomede @homeconnectapp @homeconnectplus#27photochallenge #mobility #ebike #motorsport #home #smarthome #technology

What was your childhood dream job? 🧒💭As a child, Mustafa Kamil was curious about technology, today he works for Bosch as a project manager and is responsible for the verification and validation of the lidar sensor.Lidar (light detection and ranging) sensors are a vital component for automated driving. A lidar sensor operates as a laser-based distance meter, depicting objects in high resolution. By doing so, it is able to generate a 3D representation of the vehicle’s surroundings.Mustafa and his team of 30 specialists across the globe play a crucial role in the development and success of the lidar sensor. He credits this diverse range of backgrounds and skills for making it possible to overcome the complex challenges in lidar sensor development. #BoschIAA #IAA21 #automateddriving #sensors #AI #artificialintelligence #futuremobility #selfdrivingcars #mobility

Sustainable solutions for mobility and households: This year's @iaamobility is not only taking place at the Messe München, but also includes an Open Space area in Munich's inner city. Here, Bosch experts are showcasing our technology for smart and sustainable mobility and homes. 🏡 Next to our solutions for eBikes, eScooters, and Formula E race cars, visitors can explore @boschsmarthomede products that enable users to intelligently connect different parts of their home for greater convenience and safety. 📲 Or they can check out our @homeconnectapp, with which smart home appliances can be connected and controlled remotely, enabling for them to be switch on and off, put into eco-mode, and more. 🍃 Additionally, we're also showing how our intelligent energy manager makes it possible for homeowners to reduce CO2 emissions and save energy costs. Watch the video for some impressions from our #IAA21 Open Space! #BoschIAA #mobility #smarthome #homeconnect #technology

What are the key features of the mobility of the future? 🤔Watch the video and find out what Stefan Hartung, chairman of the Bosch Mobility Solutions business sector, says about automotive trends, innovations, and challenges at @iaamobility in Munich, Germany.#BoschIAA #IAA21 #mobility #technology #automateddriving #connectedmobility

🚘🅿️ Parking, washing, and charging your car via smartphone command? With automated valet parking, it's possible!At this year's @iaamobility in Munich, Germany, we are presenting automated valet parking, a fully-automated and driverless parking function, together with the German Association of the Automotive Industry (VDA) and nine project partners.In live demonstrations, the interaction between intelligent parking garage infrastructure developed by us and other project partners, and vehicle technology in vehicles from various manufacturers, is being shown. This interaction enables cars to be parked driverlessly within the parking garage, as well as other convenience services such as automated washing and charging. #BoschIAA #IAA21 #automateddriving #automatedparking #mobility

🔌🚘 Recharging your electric car has never been easier – thanks to the world's first electric-car charging cable with integrated technology for flexible recharging without a bulky control box. In addition to being some 40% lighter compared to conventional charging cables with control box, it comes with adapters for Type 2 and household plugs which allows charging at home or on the road without needing a second cable. 🙌At this year's @IAAmobility, we're premiering this new addition to our broad electromobility portfolio. Stay tuned for more on our climate-friendly solutions for all kinds of mobility to follow on our channel this week!#BoschIAA #IAA21 #mobility #electromobility #electricvehicle #electricvehiclecharging #electricdrive

Writing the next chapter of eBike mobility: With our fully connected eBike system, we're creating the basis for eBiking to become smarter, more comfortable, and safer. 🚴‍♀️🚴‍♂️📱 At the heart: our eBike Flow app. As the central connection to the eBike with the smart system, it allows you for example to load new and improved functions directly onto the eBike via updates "over the air."🌐 And we're paving the way for more: By connecting the eBike to the internet, it will become part of the Internet of Things (IoT) – with great potential for the future, including for instance remote access or the data exchange with other road users and infrastructure, making your journey safer. Learn more about our vision for the future of eBiking at @IAAmobility next week. Check out @boschebikesystems for more about our eBike solutions.#IAA21 #BoschIAA #eBike #FeelTheFlow #connectedbiking #cycling #ebiking #streetflow #uphillflow #boschebike

What do smart Bosch sensors 💡 and breast milk 🍼 have to do with each other? Both play the main roles in our "Milky Way" project in Vietnam!Here, we are helping new moms, who wish to keep breastfeeding beyond maternity leave, with their return to work: "Milky Way" is a breast milk delivery service between the mother’s workplace and her baby’s daycare. The solution is based on a cooling box with Bosch sensor technology. A combined humidity, temperature, and pressure sensor helps ensure both the freshness and safety of the milk.Want to find out more? Hi, from the Bosch Global Instagram team. 👋 Did you know that all of our 400 Bosch locations worldwide have been carbon neutral since 2020? 🌍 🍃To achieve this goal, we have been relying on various ways of reducing carbon dioxide emissions for several years. 💡🧰 At Bosch, we turn plastic waste into sustainable packaging! Since 2018, recycled plastic has been used in manufacturing more than one million cases for the green product line of our power tools! 👏 1,146 metric tons of plastic were replaced with recycled material within two years. "The whole thing is a win-win situation for us, because raw material is scarce on the market," explains Tamás Sándor, packaging expert and member of the project team at our plant in Miskolc, Hungary. "The recycled packaging not only helps Bosch to cut costs, but also does something good for the environment." #sustainability #packaging #sustainable #recyclability #recycling #ecofriendly #carbonneutral #carbonneutrality

🏎️ ⚡ 🏆 The 2020/2021 season has been a memorable one for us! 👓👀🦺 Safety vision: smartglasses with Bosch's Light Drive technology can help cyclists, like athlete @tillschenklive, to stay safe on the road. Light Drive displays vital information without obstructing the rider's vision, for example, if there's a vehicle or a dangerous bend ahead. The smartglasses can also show navigation prompts, text messages, and automatically adjust brightness, all while giving Till a clear view of the road ahead.#smartglasses #roadsafety #technology #cyclist #cycling #ultracycling #fitness

📱➡️👓 These are not your ordinary glasses…Smartglasses with Bosch's Light Drive technology detect push notifications from devices connected via Bluetooth, such as a smartphone or heart rate monitor. A micro-opto-electro-mechanical systems (MOEMs) scanner unit relays the image to the lens, which is lined with see-through holographic optical foil. The image is then sent to the wearer's eye.With its compact design, this Bosch solution is the smallest and lightest on the market – weighing just 40 grams. It can be installed in most glasses, including prescription and sports glasses.#smartglasses #technology #bluetooth #connected #MOEMs #fitness #ultracycling #cycling

🚴‍♂️ A true sidekick on the go!Smartglasses with Bosch's Light Drive technology provide extreme athlete @tillschenklive with everything he needs for his biggest adventure to date: "Everesting" – to ascend and descend an incline as many times as it takes to climb the equivalent of Mount Everest – on all seven continents! ▶️ Watch the video to see Till and his smartglasses in action.#smartglasses #everesting #technology #fitness #ultracycling #cycling

👓 Seeing what matters: staying focused is key for extreme athlete @tillschenklive. Despite being diagnosed with glandular fever that threatened to end his sporting career, Till's determination and focus has resulted in him becoming a renowned ultra-cyclist. With the help of his smartglasses with Bosch's Light Drive technology, Till can push himself to the limit when he trains for 30 hours a week.Rather than conjuring up complex virtual 3D worlds, Light Drive provides Till with the exact information he needs, whether it's his vital signs or route map.#smartglasses #sport #technology #cyclist

🔥🚒🚨 Do you speak the language of fire? We’ll teach you the basics in the latest episode of our "From KNOW-HOW to WOW" podcast! Our hosts Melena and Geoff talk to firefighter Shan Raffel who is a true luminary and teaches firefighters around the world how to “read fire” in order to stop it in its tracks. Bosch experts Caroline Hartl and Soeren Wittmann introduce us to AI in firefighting. They both work on Aviotec – a video-based fire detection system that visually recognizes fire and smoke. Using deep learning, the system is being developed to work in different environments and to feed information to firefighters like Shan – so on arrival at the scene, they know exactly what they are facing.Listen to this episode and more on podcast platforms such as Podigee, Apple Podcasts, Deezer, and Spotify! Simply search for "From KNOW-HOW to WOW" and get ready to be wowed. 😎#podcast #firedetection #AI #ArtificialIntelligence #deeplearning

Support for the victims of the flood disaster in Germany: To help relieve some of the distress, Bosch makes a contribution in the form of monetary and material donations. By donating 1 million euros, the company supports the work of the @germanredcross on site.In addition, Bosch Power Tools is supplying the Technisches Hilfswerk, Germany’s federal emergency management organization, with tools such as rotary hammers, angle grinders, high-pressure cleaners, and chainsaws. Associates of BSH Home Appliances are arranging cash donations for @aktion_deutschland_hilft, also known as Germany’s Relief Coalition. The BSH board of management has agreed to double the total amount raised. Around 500 washing machines are also to be donated to @die_johanniter, a German voluntary humanitarian organization, which will coordinate the distribution of the machines to affected households. Bosch Thermotechnology plans to help by donating new heating systems to social organizations.

Floating through the International Space Station – thankfully, our SoundSee system does not get space sick on its mission! 🤢🛰️😉But what is the technology, mounted on a cube-shaped @NASA mini robot, doing in space? Developed by Bosch and @astrobotictechnology, SoundSee uses a custom array of microphones and machine learning capabilities, so that it can analyze the operating noises of the machinery and equipment on board the space station. Why? To help detect equipment anomalies and alert the crew early. If you want to know more, listen to our "From KNOW-HOW to WOW" podcast episode, where Bosch expert Sam Das explains how SoundSee gives meaning to the sounds it hears – here on Earth and aboard the International Space Station. You can find it on podcast platforms such as Podigee, Apple Podcasts, Deezer, and Spotify – simply search for "From KNOW-HOW to WOW" episode 2 "SoundSee: Seeing with sound."#SpaceExplorationDay #space #tech #sound #sensors #artificialintelligence #AI #machinelearning #podcast

What if vehicles could "see" what’s happening on the road around them and even make smart decisions based on that? 👀 Well, that's one of the things Bosch associates at our Cross-Domain Computing Solutions division are working on.With her teams, Johanna Michelfelder is responsible for software development: "We're currently writing code that can detect objects based on two-dimensional images from a video camera and then reconstruct these in 3D. This input is then used by other teams to develop vehicle functions – for example, partially automated parking," she says.Centralized electronic control units (ECUs) are becoming more and more the brain of these systems. Here, the signals from sensors and video cameras are being processed, and they are able to make a decision whether, for example, the vehicle should change lanes based on the signals. #parking #cars #automotive #automation #software #automateddriving

🚘 Did you know that the modern automobile is a veritable computer on wheels, with its capabilities largely determined and controlled by software and electronics? At our new Cross-Domain Computing Solutions division, we are set to play an active part in this shift in the automotive industry. Meet Johanna Michelfelder, section head for computer vision at Bosch. Together with her teams, she is responsible for developing software that helps enable new vehicle functions. "The future of mobility lies in automation - and I intend to play my part in making it a success," she says.#cars #automotive #automation #electronics #computing #software

Helmet ✅ High-visibility jacket ✅ COBI.Bike app ✅ We all want to feel safe on the road, and now eBikers can have even more peace of mind with the COBI.Bike app and Help Connect, our automated emergency call service. Using a smart algorithm, the app is able to detect when an eBike has crashed. This feature makes use of two sensors installed in most modern cellphones. Data on the location and severity of the accident is immediately transmitted to the Bosch Help Connect emergency call center. Depending on the nature of the accident, a decision is made whether to trigger an emergency callout. 🚨We are harnessing our experience in digital emergency call systems for the automotive industry to develop similar applications that boost safety for eBikers, motorcyclists – and, very soon, inhabitants of smart homes. So whether it’s on the road or at home, our "digital guardian angel" could save the day. 👼#connectivity #safety #cycling #ebike #bikes #electricbike #ebikestagram #pedelec #smarthome

⏰ Every minute counts in an emergency. This is something Tobias Lang, a paramedic with the @germanredcross rescue service, knows well. He regularly attends to fallen cyclists and eBikers.🚨 When an eBike crashes, the COBI.Bike app launches a 30-second countdown so the rider can confirm if they need help. 🔎🏭🌐 Zoomed in: At our new factory in Dresden, Germany, it's all about wafers. Wafers are 300-millimeter silicon discs that are turned into semiconductor chips in a complicated manufacturing process. The wafer fab's production is highly automated: All of the roughly 100 machines and lines in the 10,000-square-meter clean room are electronically connected – not just with each other but with the complex building infrastructure, too. By collecting the data they produce in a central database and using artificial intelligence methods to analyze it, we’re able to monitor the manufacturing process in real time. This helps us to further improve the processes and optimize maintenance work. #boschsiliconday #waferfab #AIoT #factoryofthefuture #internetofthings #IoT #AI #artificialintelligence #semiconductors #automatedmanufacturing #manufacturing

Did you know that we are the only automotive supplier that has been working intensively on microelectronics since the 1950s? 🤔Soon after starting our research, we began mass-producing our first semiconductor elements. Karl-Ernst Boeters, a pioneer in the development of integrated circuits for cars, is shown here using a microscope at the Bosch research center in Berlin in 1965. 🔬In 1970, we started the mass production of the world's first integrated circuit for cars – a cornerstone for our success in automotive electronics. 🚘 Many of today’s automotive innovations would not exist without microelectronics. For example, our sensors can register impact and trigger airbags and belt tensioners via integrated circuits. They can also detect wheels locking up and skidding movements so that digital guardian angels like ABS and ESP® can keep the vehicle on track. For us, this makes semiconductor technology truly "Invented for life."#boschsiliconday #waferfab #AIoT #factoryofthefuture #internetofthings #IoT #AI #artificialintelligence #semiconductors #automatedmanufacturing #manufacturing #automotiveelectronics #automotive #automotivetechnology #tb #tbt

Did you know that without semiconductors, cars wouldn't work, neither today nor in the future? 😲❌🚘In 2016, every new vehicle worldwide had an average of more than 9 of our chips on board, in devices such as the airbag control unit, the braking system, and the park assist system. Just a few years later, in 2019, this figure had nearly doubled to more than 17!🏭🌐 With our new wafer fab in Dresden, Germany, we're responding to the increased demand for semiconductors. The electronic components equipped with chips manufactured here will enable applications such as automated and resource-conserving driving, as well as the best possible occupant protection.#boschsiliconday #waferfab #AIoT #factoryofthefuture #internetofthings #IoT #AI #artificialintelligence #semiconductors #automatedmanufacturing #manufacturing

🎉💪 Today we officially opened our new 300-millimeter wafer fab in Dresden, Germany. Here are some facts about the new factory: 🏭 As our first AIoT factory, it combines artificial intelligence and the Internet of Things in the semiconductor manufacturing process and is one of the world's most modern chip factories. 🧍 250 people are already working in the wafer fab on some 72,000 square meters of floor space, with the workforce set to grow to roughly 700 associates.🚘 The focus will be the manufacturing of automotive microchips to be used, for example, for automated driving applications.💰 At roughly one billion euros, the new manufacturing facility is the biggest single investment in our more than 130-year history.Stay tuned for more insights into our factory of the future and our history in semiconductor manufacturing as well as their application following this week. #boschsiliconday #waferfab #AIoT #factoryofthefuture #internetofthings #IoT #AI #artificialintelligence #semiconductors #automatedmanufacturing #manufacturing

More eBikes ➡️ Higher speed and longer distances ➡️ More accidents?🚲🔋 What do you think? How safe is it to ride an eBike? Our accident research team at Bosch Research took a closer look at this question. They investigate real-world traffic crashes to identify potentially critical safety issues at an early stage. What they found out:1️⃣ eBikes provide electrical support up to 25 km/h – allowing you to keep going for longer, covering greater distances, and overcoming greater differences in altitude. However, most pedelec riders do not make use of the maximum speed at all. The initial speed of eBikes is on average ~2 km/h faster than that of conventional bikes. 2️⃣ On average, pedelec riders cover up to 18 km per day, whereas cyclists ride up to 12 km. If we break the numbers down to the overall km traveled, this results in 2,123 accidents with personal injuries per billion km total mileage for pedelecs and 6,572 for conventional bicycles. In summary, a pedelec is just as safe to ride as a conventional bicycle. Find out more about the details of our research in the Bosch Research Blog on bosch.com! #WorldBicycleDay#ebike #pedelec #bicycle #cargobike #electricdrive

⭐👑 Wafers are divas – and they really are the star of the show in the latest episode of our "From KNOW-HOW to WOW" podcast. AIoT stands for the combination of artificial intelligence (AI) and the internet of things (IoT). 🧼 And here, dust is the enemy. Our diva chips are very particular about that. Bosch is helping artists do what they do best: create! 🎨🖌️✨Contemporary visual artist @rivadeneira____ is turning a small computer sketch into a huge wall artwork – something that would usually be a real challenge. But thanks to our GLM 50-27 CG Professional laser measuring device and MeasureOn app, he can digitally scale up his colorful design and mark it on the wall much quicker."In combination, the laser and the app drastically reduce the number of steps involved – and therefore the amount of time I need," Roberto says.#connectivity #lasertechology #lasermeasure #powertools #graphicart #wallart #wallmural

📱📏 Our GLM 50-27 CG Professional laser measuring device and MeasureOn app are ideal for measuring the dimensions of complex surfaces. 🎨 Artist @rivadeneira____ is working on one of his latest designs: a 7 x 4 meter mural on an uneven concrete wall. MeasureOn makes this process as quick and efficient as possible, offering real-time connectivity across all devices. 🤔 But how does it work? The laser distance measurer from Bosch first transmits the measurements to the MeasureOn app via Bluetooth. The data is then sent over an encrypted link to the secure MeasureOn cloud. Thanks to the web app, Roberto can access the digital workspace from a desktop computer and bring up notes or photos on any device. 👏 This removes the need for time-consuming manual calculations, and Roberto can finish his project in just one day. #connectivity #graphicart #wallart #lasertechnology #lasermeasure #powertools

Meet contemporary visual artist @rivadeneira____! 🎨One of Roberto's latest projects was a bright and brash mural on the wall of a former industrial estate in Berlin, Germany. The idea is for his art to bring a splash of color to counter the restrictions put on culture during these difficult times. Using our GLM 50-27 CG Professional laser measuring device, he maps the dimensions of the wall. This data is then sent to the new Bosch MeasureOn app via Bluetooth and the cloud. Our digital tools help Roberto to complete his creative project much faster and with fewer errors. ✅▶️ Watch the video to see Roberto in action!#connectivity #lasertechnology #powertools #graphicart #wallmural

🔙 A throwback to 1971: Did you know that our efforts in developing technology for electromobility go back many decades? 50 years ago, Georg von Opel, grandson of the founder of the German automobile manufacturer Opel, set six world records for electric vehicles at the Hockenheimring in Germany in an Opel GT converted to electric drive. The records included for example driving the distance of 1 km, after a flying start, in 19.061 seconds at a top speed of 188.86 kph. 🏎️⚡ The car's electric drive system consisted mainly of Bosch components: We supplied both the two DC electric motors with a combined 88 kW (120 hp) and the power electronics.#electromobility #electricdrive #electricvehicle #emobility #cars #carsofinstagram #automotive #automotivetechnology #history #throwback
